greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) = A175836(n)/(A175836(k)* A175836(n-k)).
comment: We assume that A175836(0)=1 since it would be the empty product.
These are the generalized binomial coefficients associated with the Dedekind psi function A001615.
Another name might be the psi-nomial coefficients.
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Rows n = 0..125 of triangle, flattened
Tom Edgar and Michael Z. Spivey, Multiplicative functions, generalized binomial coefficients, and generalized Catalan numbers, Journal of Integer Sequences, Vol. 19 (2016), Article 16.1.6.
Donald E. Knuth and Herbert S. Wilf, The power of a prime that divides a generalized binomial coefficient, J. Reine Angew. Math., 396:212-219, 1989.
example: The first five terms in the Dedekind psi function are 1,3,4,6,6 and so T(4,2) = 6*4*3*1/((3*1)*(3*1))=8 and T(5,3) = 6*6*4*3*1/((4*3*1)*(3*1))=12.
maple: A175836 := proc(n) option remember; local p;
mathematica: (* b = A175836 *) b[n_] := Times @@ DedekindPsi /@ Range[n];
program: P=[0]+[i*prod([(1+1/x) for x in prime_divisors(i)]) for i in [1..q]]
[[prod(P[1:n+1])/(prod(P[1:k+1])*prod(P[1:(n-k)+1])) for k in [0..n]] for n in [0..len(P)-1]] #generates the triangle up to q rows.
f xs (z:zs) = (map (div y) $ zipWith (*) ys $ reverse ys) : f ys zs
where ys = y : xs; y = head xs * z
results.author: _Tom Edgar_, Feb 27 2014
